body.p: The service cost component includes current service cost, past service cost and any gain or loss on settlement, but excludes changes in the defined benefit obligation that result from changes in demographic assumptions that are included in the remeasurements component together with other actuarial gains and losses. In the Board’s view, including the effect of changes in demographic assumptions in the service cost component would combine amounts with different predictive values and, consequently, the service cost component is more relevant for assessing an entity’s continuous operational costs if it does not include changes in past estimates of service cost. Most respondents agreed with the proposals in the 2010 ED that service cost should exclude changes in demographic assumptions.
